pros: Hospice work in any capacity or location is worthy work.

pros: A company that lives it’s values.
cons: I do not have any cons to list.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Schedule flexibility, staff members get along, little micro-managing
cons: Pay, short-staffing, floating to other facilities

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Syracuse, NY
pros: Great supportive team and DRs
cons: Extensive documentation , usually requiring unpaid overtime

pros: There are no pros to working here.
cons: Culture is the biggest con. There are basically two CEO’s, which makes things very confusing strategy wise and doesn’t foster good relationships between departments. HR knows this so their hands are tied and they will tell you. Company also didn’t pivot during COVID so they are stuck in pre COVID times, no remote work, barely any pto, holidays not observed.  IT, finance and other depts who should’ve moved more digitally in the last few years, are stuck in the old days. Depts can’t keep people employed. My dept alone lost 7 people during the first 3 months. Please do your research before joining.

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great people and mid level management
cons: Upper level management out of touch with workers in the field

job_title: Medical Records Clerk in Jacksonville, FL
pros: well oiled machine, everyone works as a team
cons: small work area and ventilation

job_title: RN Floor Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Always stocked with necessary supplies to care for patients. Less strenuous and stressful than hospital settings.
cons: Short staffed, over worked employees with little to no appreciation, more responsibilities with no pay increase, lack of communication, and benefits are not the best. Co-workers are hit and miss, some are great and help with flexibility while others simply don’t.

job_title: Hospice Admissions RN in Jacksonville, FL
pros: This is one of the least-stressful nursing jobs I’ve held in the past 12 years. I do not feel micromanaged or pressured to meet quotas. Most of the management and coworkers are genuinely nice, caring people.
cons: The management area feel unstable. The feelings of caring and kindness do not extend into some higher management personnel. I would be hesitant to advance because it seems to put a target on your back. In less than a year one manager was fired and another stepped down.

pros: Great pay and people here.
cons: Benefits aren’t the best but it’s ok.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great managers, reasonable caseloads, generous PTO
cons: Low pay, staffing shortages, spotty coverage for days off

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Always feel appreciated for the difficult job
cons: Understaffed, always a ton of work and not enough people.

pros: Working from home (for now)
cons: Directives change quicker than the Florida weather, mgmt is condescending, the amount of work is ridiculous for the pay, they have no sense of structure when it comes to management. Good luck requesting your desired schedule, it won’t happen. Also goood luck moving up, you won’t unless you’re friends with someone in upper management or you’re someone’s daughter.

pros: Health insurance coverage is good.
cons: Brutally harsh culture. Muscled to results.

pros: Wonderful company to work for great benfits
cons: Feel like you can never disconnect.

pros: Do not allow this company to recruit you. They can change their business plan at any moment without regard to your personal sacrifice in relocating for employment.
cons: Great care from the teams for the patients.

pros: help people at end of life
cons: move to much from place to place

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Family work home balance is good
cons: Pay is on the low end

review_title: Lack of communication, vision, don't value employees
pros: Work with some wonderful, compassionate and caring people. Providing the best care to patients and families is very rewarding. Have computers/iPhones which is better than writing out notes. Non-profit organization with an out-going CEO Susan who I believe has had the heart and compassion to make this agency what it is. Some managers are better organized and are more effective.
cons: Current upper management not in touch with day to day work of employees. Lack of vision, organization and terrible communication. Some managers are poor, yet they still are there. Don't feel valued as an employee. You have outside companies so surveys and meetings, but none of their suggestions taken. Continue the same old way. Turn over of HR and staff.

pros: The job is rewarding because you are helping families transition during end of life care. Hours are great  (Monday -Friday) 830am-5pm.
cons: Pay is not comparable to job expectations and roles. There are not any bonuses given. Company policies are constantly changing and the communication very rarely makes it to the lower level employees. The morale of the organization has declined with so many changes in administration and management levels. The organization is all about profit and not staff morale or patient care.

pros: Working here allowed me to provide needed services to patients and their families.  Their mission statement, "To improve the quality of life for patients and families and to be the compassionate guide for end-of-life care in our community" is something to be proud of.
cons: Leadership was more interested in advancing thier friends, colleagues, etc. than recognizing the value, knowledge, and skill sets of thier existing employees.  Even when advancement opportunities presented themselves, they were more likely to select someone from their church community or previous place of employment rather than supporting the development of their highly capable internal employees.

pros: Decent (not great) pay. Mostly compassionate coworkers. Meaningful job.
cons: Work schedules provided very late. You can't have a life or plan for any time off. Poor management.  Pt/pt families misled about services to get them to sign up for hospice. Poor communication between home/inpatient/hospital teams. Rules only applied to some employees when convenient to discipline them.Company boasts "nonProfit" and charitable, but administrators are overpaid.

review_title: Great organization to volunteer and receive care from
pros: GREAT SERVICE to the community. No other provides better care and compassion for their patients and families. Great Grief and loss support for all family members.
cons: Executives are out of touch with staff and mentality change is needed

review_title: Good job to get your feet wet!
